00002 #define __INTERVAL_TREE_H

00006 #include <algorithm>
00007 #include <iostream>

00009 using namespace std;

00011 template <class T, typename K = int>
00012   class EInterval {
00013   public:
00014   K start;
00015   K stop;
00016   T value;
00017   EInterval()
00018   : start(0)
00019   , stop(INT_MAX)
00020   , value("")
00021   { }
00022   EInterval(K s, K e, const T& v)
00023   : start(s)
00024   , stop(e)
00025   , value(v)
00026   { }
00027 };
00028 
00029 template <class T, typename K = int>
00030   int intervalStart(const EInterval<T,K>& i) {
00031   return i.start;
00032 }
00033 
00034   template <class T, typename K = int>
00035   int intervalStop(const EInterval<T,K>& i) {
00036     return i.stop;
00037   }
00038 
00039     template <class T, typename K = int>
00040   ostream& operator<<(ostream& out, EInterval<T,K>& i) {
00041       out << "Interval(" << i.start << ", " << i.stop << "): " << i.value;
00042       return out;
00043     }
00044 
00045       template <class T, typename K = int>
00046   class IntervalStartSorter {
00047         public:
00048         bool operator() (const EInterval<T,K>& a, const EInterval<T,K>& b) {
00049           return a.start < b.start;
00050         }
00051       };
00052 
00053 template <class T, typename K = int>
00054   class EIntervalTree {
00055 
00056   public:
00057   typedef EInterval<T,K> interval;
00058   typedef vector<interval> intervalVector;
00059   typedef EIntervalTree<T,K> intervalTree;
00060     
00061   intervalVector intervals;
00062   intervalTree* left;
00063   intervalTree* right;
00064   int center;
00065 
00066   EIntervalTree<T,K>(void)
00067   : left(NULL)
00068   , right(NULL)
00069   , center(0)
00070   { }
00071 
00072   EIntervalTree<T,K>(const intervalTree& other) {
00073     center = other.center;
00074     intervals = other.intervals;
00075     if (other.left) {
00076       left = (intervalTree*) malloc(sizeof(intervalTree));
00077       *left = *other.left;
00078     } else {
00079       left = NULL;
00080     }
00081     if (other.right) {
00082       right = new intervalTree();
00083       *right = *other.right;
00084     } else {
00085       right = NULL;
00086     }
00087   }
00088 
00089   EIntervalTree<T,K>& operator=(const intervalTree& other) {
00090     center = other.center;
00091     intervals = other.intervals;
00092     if (other.left) {
00093       left = new intervalTree();
00094       *left = *other.left;
00095     } else {
00096       left = NULL;
00097     }
00098     if (other.right) {
00099       right = new intervalTree();
00100       *right = *other.right;
00101     } else {
00102       right = NULL;
00103     }
00104     return *this;
00105   }
00106 
00107   EIntervalTree<T,K>(
00108                     intervalVector& ivals,
00109                     unsigned int depth = 16,
00110                     unsigned int minbucket = 64,
00111                     int leftextent = 0,
00112                     int rightextent = 0,
00113             unsigned int maxbucket = 512
00114                     )
00115   : left(NULL)
00116   , right(NULL)
00117   {
00118 
00119     --depth;
00120     if (depth == 0 || (ivals.size() < minbucket && ivals.size() < maxbucket)) {
00121       intervals = ivals;
00122     } else {
00123       if (leftextent == 0 && rightextent == 0) {
00124         // sort intervals by start
00125         IntervalStartSorter<T,K> intervalStartSorter;
00126         sort(ivals.begin(), ivals.end(), intervalStartSorter);
00127       }
00128 
00129       int leftp = 0;
00130       int rightp = 0;
00131       int centerp = 0;
00132             
00133       if (leftextent || rightextent) {
00134         leftp = leftextent;
00135         rightp = rightextent;
00136       } else {
00137         leftp = ivals.front().start;
00138         vector<K> stops;
00139         stops.resize(ivals.size());
00140         transform(ivals.begin(), ivals.end(), stops.begin(), intervalStop<T,K>);
00141         rightp = *max_element(stops.begin(), stops.end());
00142       }
00143 
00144       //centerp = ( leftp + rightp ) / 2;
00145       centerp = ivals.at(ivals.size() / 2).start;
00146       center = centerp;
00147 
00148       intervalVector lefts;
00149       intervalVector rights;
00150 
00151       for (typename intervalVector::iterator i = ivals.begin(); i != ivals.end(); ++i) {
00152         interval& interval = *i;
00153         if (interval.stop < center) {
00154           lefts.push_back(interval);
00155         } else if (interval.start > center) {
00156           rights.push_back(interval);
00157         } else {
00158           intervals.push_back(interval);
00159         }
00160       }
00161 
00162       if (!lefts.empty()) {
00163         left = new intervalTree(lefts, depth, minbucket, leftp, centerp);
00164       }
00165       if (!rights.empty()) {
00166         right = new intervalTree(rights, depth, minbucket, centerp, rightp);
00167       }
00168     }
00169   }
00170 
00171   void findOverlapping(K start, K stop, intervalVector& overlapping) {
00172     if (!intervals.empty() && ! (stop < intervals.front().start)) {
00173       for (typename intervalVector::iterator i = intervals.begin(); i != intervals.end(); ++i) {
00174         interval& interval = *i;
00175         if (interval.stop >= start && interval.start <= stop) {
00176           overlapping.push_back(interval);
00177         }
00178       }
00179     }
00180 
00181     if (left && start <= center) {
00182       left->findOverlapping(start, stop, overlapping);
00183     }
00184 
00185     if (right && stop >= center) {
00186       right->findOverlapping(start, stop, overlapping);
00187     }
00188 
00189   }
00190 
00191   void findContained(K start, K stop, intervalVector& contained) {
00192     if (!intervals.empty() && ! (stop < intervals.front().start)) {
00193       for (typename intervalVector::iterator i = intervals.begin(); i != intervals.end(); ++i) {
00194         interval& interval = *i;
00195         if (interval.start >= start && interval.stop <= stop) {
00196           contained.push_back(interval);
00197         }
00198       }
00199     }
00200 
00201     if (left && start <= center) {
00202       left->findContained(start, stop, contained);
00203     }
00204 
00205     if (right && stop >= center) {
00206       right->findContained(start, stop, contained);
00207     }
00208 
00209   }
00210 
00211   ~EIntervalTree(void) {
00212     // traverse the left and right
00213     // delete them all the way down
00214     if (left) {
00215       delete left;
00216     }
00217     if (right) {
00218       delete right;
00219     }
00220   }
00221 
00222 };

00224 #endif
